parts.textUpper: The use of oil lamps began thousands of years ago and continues to this day although not commonly anymore.
parts.instruction: Tap on the lamp to open it

parts.textUpper: An oil lamp is an object used to produce light continuously for a period of time using an oil-based fuel source.
parts.instruction: Drag the flask to the lamp to fill it

parts.textUpper: 2 litres  of lamp oil will last about 256 hours. If you burned 6 hours a day, 2 litres of lamp oil would last you about 42 days
parts.instruction: Drag the stick to the lampâ€™s wick to light the lamp

parts.textUpper: Oil lamps burned cleaner, with less smoke, than candles and other sources of light before electricity.
parts.instruction: Tap on the lamp to continue

parts.textUpper: A light bulb is also known as an incandescent light bulb, incandescent lam or an incandescent light globe. The average lifetime of a household light bulb is around 1,000 hours.
parts.instruction: Tap on the switch to turn on the light bulb

parts.textUpper: Nowadays we have light wherever we go
